title.text: Design of a Lexical Database for Sanskrit

abstractContent.text: We present the architectural design rationale of a Sanskrit computational linguistics platform , where the lexical database has a central role.
We explain the structuring requirements issued from the interlinking of grammatical tools through its hypertext rendition.

introductionContent.text: Electronic dictionaries come into two distinct flavours: digital sources of dictionaries and encyclopedia, meant for human usage, and lexical databases, developed for computational linguistics needs.
There is little interaction between the two forms, mostly for sociological reasons.
We shall argue, in this communication, that a lexical database maybe used for both purposes, to mutual advantage.
We base our thesis on a concrete experiment on the design of linguistics resources for the Sanskrit language.
